DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the inherited platelet abnormality classification.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A group of rare inherited platelet disorders that involve abnormalities of platelet function or platelet production and that usually cause moderate to severe bleeding problems._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A group of rare inherited platelet disorders that involve abnormalities of platelet function or platelet production and that usually cause moderate to severe bleeding problems._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare disorder of infancy characterized by marked reduction or absence of megakaryocytes and thrombocytopenia.: Any abnormality, anatomical or biochemical, evident at birth or during the neonatal period.: A condition in which there is an abnormally small number of platelets in the circulating blood.

Concepts.definition: A rare disorder of infancy characterized by marked reduction or absence of megakaryocytes and thrombocytopenia.
Any abnormality, anatomical or biochemical, evident at birth or during the neonatal period.
A laboratory test result indicating that there is an abnormally small number of platelets in the circulating blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: A group of rare inherited platelet disorders that involve abnormalities of platelet function or platelet production and that usually cause moderate to severe bleeding problems.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A group of rare inherited platelet disorders that involve abnormalities of platelet function or platelet production and that usually cause moderate to severe bleeding problems.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare, autosomal recessive inherited and less frequently acquired platelet disorder. It is characterized by deficient or dysfunctional glycoprotein IIb/IIIa complex. It leads to defective platelet aggregation, resulting in bleeding.

Concepts.definition: A rare, autosomal recessive inherited and less frequently acquired platelet disorder. It is characterized by deficient or dysfunctional glycoprotein IIb/IIIa complex. It leads to defective platelet aggregation, resulting in bleeding.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A group of rare inherited platelet disorders that involve abnormalities of platelet function or platelet production and that usually cause moderate to severe bleeding problems.:A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A group of rare inherited platelet disorders that involve abnormalities of platelet function or platelet production and that usually cause moderate to severe bleeding problems.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
